data.name: ID Number Validation
data.description:
A country uses an unique 11 digit id number for its citizens. This id number has some characteristics and in this kata you should write a function that takes id number as input, and returns whether it is valid or not.

ID number has following characteristics:
- Never starts with 0
- Last 2 digits are calculated digits:
  - 10th digit is remainder from division by 10 of the number calculated by subtracting sum of every even digit from 7 times of sum of every odd digit.
  - 11th digit is the remainder from division by 10 of the sum of first 10 digits.

Example:
-
For the number 10562272296, first 9 digits are: 105622722

Calculation of 10th digit:
- Sum of odd digits: 1 + 5 + 2 + 7 + 2 = 17
- Multiply by 7: 17 * 7 = 119
- Sum of even digits: 0 + 6 + 2 + 2 = 10
- Subtracting sum of even digits from 7 times of sum of odd digits: 119 - 10 = 109 
- Remainder from division by 10: 109 % 10 = 9 gives the 10th digit.

Calculation of 11th digit:
- Sum of first 10 digits: 1 + 0 + 5 + 6 + 2 + 2 + 7 + 2 + 2 + 9 = 36
- Remainder from division by 10: 36 % 10 = 6 gives the 11th digit.

For the example both 10th and 11th digits are correct. Hence the validation function should return True.

You can guarantee input will always be 11 digit number.
